data.title: Juicy Taco Truck in a Building
data.text:
Great walk up taco bar serving a wide variety of meals at slightly UP prices. Meat is very well done, but could be a bit more tender. Tortillas are handmade and a bit small, but food tastes great. Nice salsa bar and I wish they would put out the roasted red chili more often, it is off the chain! They serve Peruano beans, and I always order extra because they only give you a small scoop in the meal box.

Juice bar and smoothies are the best in Perris, CA. Servers are very helpful and courteous.

data.title: Good tacos
data.text: This place has good tacos and burritos most of the time. Sadly, sometimes they will pre-grill their meat. So, you might end up getting dried out carne asada. It's happen to me on more than a few occasions. Another thing I don't care for is that you order your food and then you have to stand in line to pay for it. Not a problem if there isn't a line, but if there is, your tacos end up getting cold. Its a pretty bad set up and makes no sense at all. On the other hand, they have a nice little salsa bar set up with all the fixings for your tacos/burritos.

data.title: Best street style TACOS!
data.text:
These were the best tasting tacos I've had this side of the border!  The service was fast. You basically walk along the counter, separated by glass from the cooks and tell them what you want in your taco.  Then you move over to the refreshing drinks made in house from real fruit.  The salsa bar is loaded with all the goodies, including variety of salsas, guacamole, guac-salsa and lots and lots of limes.

It was my first time here, I'm not from the area but I saw the large sign off the 215 Freeway.  So glad I was "adventurous", I can't wait to go back! Even writing about the tacos is making my mouth water!  The best!

data.title: Mexican Fast Food Done Right
data.text: Setting up for an event in the area, and didn't know where to grab a bite. Parking lot at this place was full & the overflow was almost full so figured that had to be a good sign. Place kind of looked like a tornado had gone through (food on the floor, counter not cleaned off) & almost walked out. But it was late so we stayed; glad we did. Meal was tasty, fast, and inexpensive. Was impressed by their "wall" of fruit choices for smoothies & aguas frescas. Decadent looking cakes made us wish we'd left room for dessert.

data.title: Almost but not there
data.text: Everything was good but everything was cold and the service was bad......  The music is very loud and you have to scream..... Prices are acceptable...

data.title: GREAT CULINARY SHOW
data.text:
I stopped in for a late breakfast.  The lot and restaurant were packed.  The smells of the Mexican food welcomed me inside.  There was a fairly long line of customers lined up to order and receive their meals.  However, the line moved quickly.

I noticed that most of the preparations took place behind the glass of the service counter.  It was a really great show.  I have never seen such hard working, hustling, cooperative and happy workers. They seemed to really enjoy their jobs and the product they produced.  

Everything looked good and you can see it made.  The only problem with that is you keep changing your mind about what you want to eat.

I ordered a burrito from their extensive menu.  It was huge and loaded with meat, beans and rice as well as salsa.  Then I proceeded to the free condiment counter and found a variety of vegetables, salsas and unlimited guacamole available to complete the burrito FOR FREE.

Great service, great food and well worth a visit.

data.title: WOW most authentic tacos. Worth the detour off the 215 to dine here on the way to San Diego !
data.text: Great choices of meats all very fresh watch them make them in front of you EXTREMELY FRESH and authentic tacos, burritos and alo more. Also have the flavored juices they make fresh right there ! Closer than going to Mexico ! Well worth the detour off the 215 to dine here on the way to San Diego ! C&H
